devanagari:
रुद्रादित्या वसवो ये च साध्या
विश्वेऽश्विनौ मरुतश्चोष्मपाश्च ।
गन्धर्वयक्षासुरसिद्धसङ्घा
वीक्षन्ते त्वां विस्मिताश्चैव सर्वे ॥ २२ ॥
transliteration:
rudrādityā vasavo ye ca sādhyāḥ
viśve 'śvinau marutaś coṣmapāś ca
gandharva-yakṣāsura-siddha-saṅghāḥ
vīkṣante tvāṁ vismitāś caiva sarve
translation: All the hosts of demigods—Rudras, Ādityas, Vasus, Sādhyas, Viśvadevas, the Aśvinīkumāras, the Maruts, the forefathers, the Gandharvas, the Yakṣas, Asuras and the Siddhas—are all looking at You in astonishment.
purport: This verse underscores the overwhelming majesty of the Lord's universal form. All types of celestial beings from different categories of cosmic administration—whether demigods, sages, forefathers, or mystical beings—are depicted as being struck with awe upon witnessing this form. It shows that even the highest beings in the universe are subordinate to Kṛṣṇa's supreme manifestation. Arjuna, as a human, shares this experience with the divine beings, further highlighting the special mercy and elevated status granted to him. This moment exemplifies that the universal form is not a normal experience, even for the gods, and evokes universal reverence.
